sentences.en: “the excitement of combat, of living on the edge”(&b{Nelson DeMille})
sentences.cn: “由一触即发的战斗引起的激动”(&b{纳尔逊·德米耶})

sentences.en: a grating that set her teeth on edge.
sentences.cn: 让她觉得牙根发痒的刺耳磨擦声。

sentences.en: a knife with a sharp edge
sentences.cn: 刀刃锋利的小刀

sentences.en: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
sentences.cn: 地上有一片叶子，叶边卷曲着。

sentences.en: A little cognac slopped over the edge of the glass.
sentences.cn: 有一点白兰地溢出了玻璃杯。

sentences.en: A spell of poor health took the edge off her performance.
sentences.cn: 一度身体欠佳令她表现有失水准。

sentences.en: But underneath the humour is an edge of bitterness.
sentences.cn: 但是幽默的背后却透着怨气。

sentences.en: David moved cautiously forward and looked over the edge.
sentences.cn: 戴维小心翼翼地往前挪，从边缘向下张望。

sentences.en: He edged her towards the door.
sentences.cn: 他慢慢地把她往门口推。

sentences.en: He miskicked the ball twice at the edge of the penalty box.
sentences.cn: 在禁区边缘他两次将球踢飞。

sentences.en: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
sentences.cn: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.en: Luton conceded a free kick on the edge of the penalty area.
sentences.cn: 卢顿未能在罚球区的边缘截住对方的任意球。

sentences.en: McNally has spent 17 years at the bleeding edge of computing.
sentences.cn: 麦克纳利已经在计算技术的最前沿工作了17年。

sentences.en: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
sentences.cn: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.en: She edged closer to get a better look.
sentences.cn: 她慢慢地靠近，想看得清楚一些。

sentences.en: She skirted round the edge of the room to the door.
sentences.cn: 她贴着房间的墙边走到了门口。

sentences.en: She was perched on the edge of the sofa.
sentences.cn: 她坐在沙发沿上。

sentences.en: The downhill racer edged her opponent out on the middle stretch.
sentences.cn: 下坡滑雪赛的选手将她的对手慢慢挤出中央跑道

sentences.en: The standard of living today is on the edge of subsistence.
sentences.cn: 现在的生活水平几乎快要无法维持生计。

sentences.en: the tablets will take the edge off the pain.
sentences.cn: 这些药片可以减轻疼痛。

sentences.en: They all walked barefoot across the damp sand to the water's edge.
sentences.cn: 他们全都光着脚走过潮湿的沙地来到水边。

sentences.en: This is an irritation and inflammation of the edge of the eyelid.
sentences.cn: 这是眼睑边缘红肿发炎的症状。

sentences.en: This shipyard is at the cutting edge of world shipbuilding technology.
sentences.cn: 该造船厂的造船技术处于世界最前沿。

sentences.en: Through superior production techniques they were able to gain the competitive edge.
sentences.cn: 凭借先进的生产技术，他们得以占据竞争优势。

sentences.en: Tim was edging away from the crowd.
sentences.cn: 蒂姆慢慢地从人群中走开。

sentences.en: What we are planning is cutting-edge technology never seen in Australia before.
sentences.cn: 我们正在开发的是一种在澳大利亚从未有过的尖端技术。

words.tran_cn: 急躁的；尖利的；刀口锐利的
使开刃；加边于；侧着移动（edge的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 排挤掉：以微弱优势超过或胜过
前沿；居领先优势；最先着风的帆缘
紧张的：高度紧张或不安的；易怒的
激动，兴奋：处于高度兴奋状态，如由危险或冒险引起的

phrases.phrase: on the edge of one's seat
phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)十分兴奋的，兴奋得坐不住的；全神贯注的
（尤指刺耳声音）使人觉得牙根发痒，使人觉得十分刺耳
直尺，平尺；校正装置，直棱

trans.tran_cn: 边线，刀锋，（危险）临界点，优势，影响力，尖锐声调
trans.tran_en: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre

trans.tran_cn: 缓慢地移动，给…加边，略微增加（变好）
trans.tran_en: to put something on the edge or border of something

trans.tran_cn: 侧着移动， 徐徐移动
trans.tran_en: to move gradually with several small movements, or to make something do this
